page.title: 02THE RURAL LANDSCAPE
page.content: FEATURES OF THE RELIEF The block is dominated by the flat flood plain of the River Severn, here less than 10 metres above sea level. The river averages 70 metre wide here and flows deceptively strongly between tree-lined banks. On either side of the river are level meadows often with deep pools of water behind the raised banks. To the Northeast the land rises gently up to Sandhurst Hill (GR:838247). At 86 metres it is the highest point and from it almost all the block is visible. West of the river a long ridge drops steeply to the flood plain. More wooded, this just reaches 80 metres and offers good views of the river and the country to the South and East. Farms and orchards dominate, the whole area is quite sparsely populated. Even Sandhurst village merges into its sur- roundings effectively.
